dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 416 IH: Sports Gaming Opportunity Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. LoBiondo (for himself, Mr. Frelinghuysen, Mr. Lance, and Mr. Smith of New Jersey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend chapter 178 of title 28 of the United States Code to permit during a 4-year period States to enact statutes that exempt from the operation of such chapter, lotteries, sweepstakes, and other betting, gambling, or wagering schemes involving professional and amateur sports.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sports Gaming Opportunity Act of 2015.
Section 3704(a) of title 28, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3) by striking or at the end,
in paragraph (4) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or, and
by adding at the end the following:
a lottery, sweepstakes, or other betting, gambling, or wagering scheme in a State authorized by such State by an applicable statute—

subparagraph.text: enacted on or after January 1, 2015, and
as in effect not later than January 1, 2019.
